pageContext._xxxcollectionOwnerNamextxt: New York Public Library for the Performing Arts, Dorothy and Lewis B. Cullman Center
pageContext._xxxcollectionDescriptionxtxt: Karen Kain speaks with Kyra Lynn Kaptzan about her early training at the National Ballet of Canada School and studying with Betty Oliphant; joining the National Ballet of Canada; dancing with Roland Petit's company; performing in the 1973 International Ballet Competition in Moscow; dancing on a raked stage; her favorite roles; working with Rudolf Nureyev; her guest appearance with the Bolshoi Ballet, touring with the National Ballet of Canada; leisure activities; filming dance for television, including James Kudelka's work A party, for the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation; a typical work day; future plans.
